analyzed: ste; sems can rnams kyi lus kyi nad rlung las gyur pa dang / mkhris pa las gyur pa dang / bad kan las gyur pa dang / 'dus pa las gyur pa dang / de bzhin du sems kyi nad 'dod chags dang / zhes dang dang /

translated: May the sufferings of heat, cold, encountering the unpleasant, being separated from the pleasant, the suffering of exhaustion, and the suffering of searching be completely pacified.

original: yun ji srid du ting nge 'dzin de lta bu dang ldan pa de srid kyi bar du sems can rnams brtson 'grus dang ldan par gyur cig /
analyzed: yun ji srid du ting nge 'dzin de lta bu dang ldan pa de srid kyi bar du sems can rnams brtson 'grus dang ldan par gyur cig /

analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad dang bral ba rnams dge ba'i chos thams cad la brtson 'grus par gyur cig /

original: yun ji srid du ting nge 'dzin de lta bu dang ldan pa de srid kyi bar du sems can rnams sems can gzhan dag la byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / phan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / mi 'khrug pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang /

analyzed: 'khrul ba med pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur cig /

original: ji srid du ting nge 'dzin de lta bu dang ldan pa de srid kyi bar du sems can rnams kyi gti mug gi mun pa dang / rtag pa dang chad par lta ba dag rab tu zhi bar gyur cig /

original: dus thams cad du lta bar 'dzin pa rnams rab tu zhi bar gyur cig /
analyzed: dus thams cad du lta bar 'dzin pa rnams rab tu zhi bar gyur cig /

original: yun ji srid du ting nge 'dzin de lta bu dang ldan pa de srid kyi bar du sems can rnams dkon mchog gsum la blo 'jug cing zhes dang ri mo byed par gyur cig /üîΩphyin ci log bzhi dang bral zhing bden @441a *//

translated: For as long as they possess such a concentration, may all sentient beings turn their minds to the Three Jewels and make offerings to them.

analyzed: pa bzhi'i rnam pa la gnas pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur cig /
translated: May they have minds free from the four errors and abiding in the aspects of the four noble truths.

analyzed: 'phags pa don dam pa'i bden pa la rnam par gnas pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur cig /

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir gang gi tshe ting nge 'dzin la 'jug par 'dod pa de'i tshe 'di ltar shes rab dang / bsod nams kyi stobs dang / thabs kyi stobs kyis 'di lta bur byin gyis rlob par byed de /

translated: When a bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva, in order to ripen sentient beings, wishes to enter into concentration, at that time, through the power of wisdom, the power of merit, and the power of skillful means, they bless in the following way:

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po snyoms par zhugs ma thag pa des ji ltar sems can rnams tshad bzung ba de bzhin du /

translated: Having donned such great armor, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva, while training and purifying the perfection of the first concentration, transcends the desire realm.

analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi yan lag rnams kyang shes par byed do //
translated: Similarly, he understands the branches of concentration.

analyzed: gang gis na sems can thams cad kyi lam gsum po las kyi lam dang // nyon mongs pa'i lam dang / sdug bsngal gyi lam dag skem par byed pa yin no //
translated: He is skilled in drying up the three paths of all beings: the path of action, the path of afflictions, and the path of suffering.
